titleStmt.title: An excellent new SONG upon the late Grand Jury.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: `What defeated WOOD's vile Scheme to ruin us? Was it not the Representations of our several Corporations, the inflexible Integrity of our GRAND JURIES, notwithstanding the Insinuations, Flattery, and even Menaces of an eminent Lord Chief Justice; and Maugre the whole Power of an English Minister?'

l.note: See Mr. Latouche's second Address, page 11.

lg.l: `Let others plead, in their Behalf, the Fame and Merit of their immediate Ancestor. I too, need not be ashamed of mine.'Ibid. p. 17.

l.note: By D. J. S. D. S. P. D.

lg.l: POOR Monsieur his conscience preserved for a year,
Yet in one hour he lost it, 'tis known far and near,
To whom did he lose it?── A judge or a peer.
«LD»Which no body can deny.
This very same conscience was sold in a closet,
For a baked loaf, or a loaf in a losset,
But a sweet sugar plumb, which you put in a posset,
«LD»Which no body can deny.
O Monsieur to sell it for nothing was nonsense,
For if you wou'd sell it, it shou'd have been long since,
But now you have lost both your cake and your conscience.
«LD»Which no body can deny.
So Nel of the dairy before she was wed,
Refused ten good guineas for her maiden-head,
Yet gave it for nothing to smooth-spoken Ned
«LD»Which no body can deny.
But Monsieur no vonder dat you vere collogue
Since selling de Contry be now all de vogue,
You be but one Fool after Seventeen Rogue.
«LD»Which no body can deny.
Some sell it for profit 'tis very well known,
And some but for sitting in sight of the throne,
And other some sell what is none of their own.
«LD»Which no body can deny.
But Philpot and Corker, and Burrows and Hayes,
And Rayner and Nicholson challenge our praise,
With Six other worthies as glorious as these.
«LD»Which no body can deny.
There's Donevan, Hart, and Archer and Blood,
And Gibson and Gerard, all true men and good,
All lovers of Ireland and haters of Wood.
«LD»Which no body can deny.
But the slaves, that wou'd sell us, shall hear on't in time,
Their names shall be branded in prose and in rhyme,
We'll paint them in colours as black as their crime.
«LD»Which no body can deny.
But P──r and copper Lat--che we'll excuse,
The commands of your betters you dare not refuse,
Obey was the word when you wore wooden shoes.
«LD»Which no body can deny.
